location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.1844 of 1855 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to the Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter relates to gifts purchased by the Government for the Shaikh of Kuwait, as reward for the assistance he offered to the stricken British packet Firozein June 1854. Anderson writes that the gifts have now been purchased, and are being sent to the Gulf on the Honourable Company’s sloop Falkland. Enclosed with Anderson’s letter is a list of the goods purchased (folio 238), dated 31 December 1854. The total value of the goods purchased in 794 rupees, 12 annas, 4 pies.
